synopsis: In episode #12 of PBR, hosts Devam and Ahir welcome their special guest Valante, a music producer and teacher, who shares his journey of overcoming childhood cancer and the impact of growing up in a creative commune. The conversation flows through themes of vulnerability, the importance of presence, and the beauty of simply existing, all while exploring the creative process behind Valante's soothing music.
quotes: Life needs to happen for a while in order for me to have something to express.
You can always find a reason to be upset about your own privilege.
It's a fine line between survivor's guilt and a savior complex.
I always felt very safe and taken care of by all older people around me.
If you want to make the world a better place, take a look at yourself and make a change.
Just because you're not giving up all of your possessions doesn't mean you're not helping.
Sometimes you can get so wrapped up in your idea of someone that you miss out on so many beautiful things about them.
I wish I could just lay on the bed and be like, why doesn't everybody just lay on the bed?
You can expect music. That's all I can promise.
Tell the people close to you that you love them. Don't wait.
